website_summaries.verdict: One of the best all-around LED headlight bulbs for quick and easy conversions on virtually any vehicle.
pros: The light pattern provides excellent, uniform coverage in the front area of the vehicle
cons: Runs hot over extended periods of use

customer_reviews.title: Very bright and outstanding color.
customer_reviews.text: The quality and build of the bulbs felt great not cheap like other led bulbs. Output is great in my zx14r projector housing with good distribution of light.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G

customer_reviews.title: 3x Brighter than stock lights! VERY easy to install on Fiesta ST
customer_reviews.text: Car: 2018 Fiesta ST .... Ive been using Opt7 products for about a year now; got their interior LED kit and just added the Fluxbeam headlights and am VERY happy with the quality, ease of installation and how bright they are compared to stock. They could pass for high beams if they were angled higher! my stock high beams are not as bright as these fluxbeams. - Installation was a breeze and couldn't have been easier. The only thing that took a little bit of time was nicely putting all the wires into my headlight assembly. Overall, I WILL be buying the foglight kit and eventually the HIGH beam kit once I have more money for fun items!!! A++++ OPT7
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: They are ALL going to fail well short of the projected life but after warranty.  TRUST ME.
customer_reviews.text: I've installed these on several cars and have had the exact same experience. They all will fail prematurely. The warranty is 2 years and tend to last that barely long but within three year are dead. Either one or both of the LED chips fail; sometimes the fan too. They are just c#@p quality. If you do decide to replace the failed bulb, just buy another pair. Trust me on this one - the second one is on its way out shortly. I know.
customer_reviews.author: thehammer

customer_reviews.title: Great Lights but Require modification
customer_reviews.text: I installed these in a 1998 Toyota Tacoma Extra-cab 4x4 3.6L and had to modify the rubber light boot that covers the back of the lens housing. I also had to use silicon oil to get the LED lights to lock in--the lights require you to twist lock or camlock into place--then attach them to the provided non-flickering assembly. Note: After cleaning my lens on the truck, this things might as well have been ARC Lights as they were that bright. They should have called them day-lighters. I would have given them 5-Stars, but they are not remove and replace as some might think. And I am an Engineer.
customer_reviews.author: Nicola

customer_reviews.title: Bright lights and great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I really had some issues with the plug and play with my truck. Had to do a little re-wiring in the end. The customer service department was outstanding in working with me through it. Kept blowing the fuses and ultimately one of the lights. Once the issue was found and fixed they sent me all new components for the one side in a very timely manner. Installed now and they are a lot brighter than the factory. Just make sure you install them with the light part of it with the bulbs facing east and west.
customer_reviews.author: Tony H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and good design.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set of H1 LED bulbs for an aftermarket projector headlight assembly. The bulb base holder/buckle were a little too big, so I have to squeeze them into the socket. Then after nine months, one of base holders began to crack. I contacted OPT7 about the issue, they immediately sent me a new complete side of H1 LED bulb. Then I found out that they already have a new design with smaller base holder, which perfect fit for my projector headlight assembly. So I contacted them again, and they gladly allowed me to exchange another H1 LED bulb to a new design bulb. Great product, great design and excellent customer service. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lizingai

customer_reviews.title: Consider before purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Product is exactly as described in listing, very bright and plug & play set up. HOWEVER I don’t like them because I wanted brighter headlights to shine father down the road and these do not “throw” as far down the road as my OEM headlights. This is not the products fault though. I have now researched and learned that is just the way it works with LED bulbs vs incandescent vs HID. So as a fog lights and just 10 feet in front of the vehicle these are amazing but they do not throw anywhere near as far as incandescent or HID. Again this is not the product at fault it is just the science to how it works.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Stickle

customer_reviews.title: Read the bad reviews first.
customer_reviews.text: F350 2008 Easy install, low beam is nice and white and lights up the road and road edge nicely. Perfect for the country roads that often have elk and deer grazing on the sides ready to step into your path. High beams are absolutely useless as they light up the trees well above the road, but do absolutly nothing for the view ahead on the road its self. See the video, you dont even notice the brightness change the reflectiveness of the road signs at 100 yards. Infact you cant see a single extra center line reflector when changing between low to high. Not worth the money I wasted.
customer_reviews.author: edward annis

customer_reviews.title: Would not recomend for duel beam application
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge fan of the FluxBeams. Have them in every car and bike. But when I installed them on a farm truck not so much a fan. All my other vehicles have separate low and high beams. The truck has this bulb which is high and low in one. Next to ZERO difference between low and high beams. You can see it change but I can drive with the high beams on and never get flashed. I'll keep them because the truck gets maybe 600 miles a year on it. Great product when you have separate bulbs, not so much for this application.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Landis

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely AMAZING headlights!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing LED bulbs! I have bought stuff from this company before, and they are awesome. I bought these for my Wife’s Chevy Equinox (2010) and they are AMAZING! The only problem was, the adapter for the H11 bulbs was wrong. I had to pull the pins out of the adapter and manually attach them to the factory harness. But the product itself is incredible. Instant on, no warm up time, and incredibly bright and even light dissipation!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Hargrove

customer_reviews.title: The OPT7 LED Headlight Kit comes with everything you need to install the headlights
customer_reviews.text: I bought my kit back in April and it arrived in 2 days in a very secure and nice package. The instructions were clear and every I needed was in the box, nothing else was needed. No cutting of wires, no enlarging holes, no customizing anything. They simply fit. I did have one headlight stop working so I contacted OPT7s warranty department via email. I received a response the same day. I filled out the form they guided me to and in short, they sent out a complete replacement. headlight with all necessary parts. Total time, 5 days. from the first contact.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Brown

customer_reviews.title: I am impressed so far
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd set of lights in the last two years. I have tried other brands and they would last about 12 months. I bought these because of the two year warranty. I have to say that out of the box they appear to be much higher quality than the previous brands. The cool control driver was something no other lights I have used came with. They even supplied zip ties to help secure the wiring. I drive a lot country back roads. Deer and livestock are always a danger. These lights really illuminate the area very well. I am considering replacing my low beam and fog lights with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Briery

customer_reviews.title: Warranty parts are always shipped in a timely manner and the boxes provided for the product has some of the best packaging I have seen
customer_reviews.text: I have bought and installed multiple of these kits into motorcycles and daily driven vehicles. They work outstanding compared to halogen and even HID bulbs. Even though I have had a couple quit working on me, OPT7 customer service is how all customer service centers should be, specifically Jullen P. He's always quick to respond to my messages or give me product related information regarding the product such as diagnosis. Warranty parts are always shipped in a timely manner and the boxes provided for the product has some of the best packaging I have seen. Whenever myself or my family buy a vehicle with halogen headlights, I will always swap them out for these LED bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S.

customer_reviews.title: 45 day update (FAILURE)
customer_reviews.text: Everything was so good. Great packaging, easy install, BRIGHT white lights..Then today one of the bulbs starts to flicker intermediately...no rhyme or reason.. Total FAILURE. Will NOT be buying the H9 or another set of H11 for the 2016 F-150.. Get what you pay for which is why the other quality LED bulbs are priced over $125 per set..
customer_reviews.author: BlueRoad

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying that a visual instruction sheet would be of great assistance. Other than that, no complaints. Installing the bulbs in my '02 Boxster was a bit tedious. I had to use needle-nosed pliers to to work the wire clips back into place, but I didn't expect the installation to be completely toolless. They seem to be very bright so far. I'll update after a week or so. Okay. It's been a week or so. They work perfectly. They're very bright and the cool white color is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Washedupmiddleagedwhitedude

customer_reviews.title: Hate to say it, but too bright
customer_reviews.text: I installed these in my 2013 Silverado. They were installed vertically and properly secured as they can only go into the housing one way. I loved the look of them and they did throw the light far, but people were constantly high beaming me. I have nothing to back it up, but it seems that these are better suited for a projector lens than a reflector housing unless for some reason I had a defective set. I gave 3 stars because they do look as described and customer service was excellent as they authorizes a return even after they were installed. Looks like I'm back to Sylvania silver star for now
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lighting at a Competitive Price and Great Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this light after doing some research on LED lighting. This one seemed to get great reviews, and the pictures of the light output from real users confirmed that this was the one to get. Everything has/had been perfect for at least a year, but I noticed one of my bulbs started to flicker. I contacted customer support and Nancy P quickly resolved my issues. I'm very happy with this product. The light output is spectacular. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: thecman02

customer_reviews.title: 9k lumens not 11k as advertised...opt7 website is correct
customer_reviews.text: They are bright but not 11k lumens...9k lumens or opt7 website or 4500 lumens per bulb....plenty bright and with adjusting the bulb in the housing and performing the aiming procedure from 25ft on a level surface they are very focused...almost too much for a regular halogen housing. They perform even better in a projector housing and its recommended. But I have a 2019 Flex with a halogen housing and I was blinding everyone...so I did the adjustments needed and they are great....so I bought the fogs for the Flex to offset how focused the beam pattern is for the headlights and voila!...problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: Jason McGuire

customer_reviews.title: Great Product but it might not fit your car
customer_reviews.text: I have used the flux beam previously with great results. My issue is with Amazon and the fitting guide for my vehicle. It claimed it works with a Toyota Highlander. Not even close. Do the plugs match? Sure. Does it fit inside the housing of the headlight? Not even close. The diameter of the LED stops it from fitting the socket. Not to mention the rear dust cap. The fan of LED excedes the depth of the light housing. Bright light, well built, delivered on time, warranted. Amazon's sizing guide per vehicle is way off.
customer_reviews.author: C. M

customer_reviews.title: Very nice upgrade from normal head lights.
customer_reviews.text: While very bright, they do not seem to go as far down the road while in traffic. This could be a design issue with my own car reflector not being designed for LED and the fact the LEDs are mounted on the sides. They are not faced forward. Overall, the lights are very bright on the sides to mid-normal expected distances. Lights are very well made and appear would last at least as long as described. Make sure you remove everything from the box, including the adapters under the lights when getting ready to install. I forgot and could not get the harness to work correctly at first. Once remember (wasted like 45 mins) they worked like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M. Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Tricky on a Subaru.
customer_reviews.text: These are outstanding. 7000 lumens and it is immediately obvious. After a lot of research I landed on OPT7 LEDs. Seems to be rated the highest of all the sites I found. Also have some of the smaller and better built drivers. The OPT7 comes with everything you need to make them work. Although I installed in a 2009 suburb outback and had to make some modifications to get them installed. 1) if you have a solid lamp cover you have to drill holes for airflow. 2) if you have the spring clamp style lamp bracket (locks lamp in the headlight), they are tricky to get in. Still work awesome. Now we will have to see if they last.
customer_reviews.author: JennBrey

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for projection headlights!
customer_reviews.text: I did not look up reviews when purchasing these headlights, just do a Google search and you will see that when they are in a projection headlights they perform worse than standard halogen bulbs. Please do your research before you purchase any headlight bulbs on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality item, great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I felt that the light output could have been brighter. It was kind of easy to install, yet I'm a car guy so I'm resourceful. On my 2015 Evo X GSR unfortunately I had to file down the bulb hole in my headlights to get the Fluxbeam to fit. Again not a huge deal, but I wasn't expecting it. As far as longevity, one bulb blew out after a month or so, but the customer service department at Opt7 sent me a new one with no issues. Very content with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A Risoldi

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. Had lights in just over a month and one is already flickering. Says return window is already closed so the only thing I'm allowed to do is write a review. Trust me and save your $90!!!!! I learned the hard way. Absolutely the worst lights to buy horrible customer service!!!! I wasted $180 on two sets!!! Junk junk junk!!!! Found out the ballast went bad, still can't get Opt7 to send just a replacement ballast!!! Horrible customer service and warranty department and service!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert wisswell II

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but not worth the premium price
customer_reviews.text: I have had several LED lamps, most half the cost of these. These are not as bright as hoped for nor do they project the distance. These are rather mediocre for the cost and performance in ‘16 Honda Accord. After adjusting the throw, I can get about 40-50’. They cover out wide well. All you need to connect them is supplied. Can’t say about longevity yet as they’ve only been installed about 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: WLR75

customer_reviews.title: These are the old lights. For $10 more, ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the old lights. For $10 more, you get over 1,000 more lumens per bulb from the new lights on their web page
customer_reviews.author: curtis apgar

customer_reviews.title: High quality headlights! You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my vehicle about 1.5 years ago and they are amazingly bright and produce a very clean solid beam with no dark spots. Came with all of the adapter pieces I needed to install with no issues. Did have 1 LED from one of the bulbs go out, but OPT7 stood by their product and Ally did an amazing job with quickly sending a replacement. I couldn’t be more impressed with the product and customer service!!! I’ll be a long term customer with them and buy their bulbs for any future needs/ vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: No flaw in the LED'S but no real gain in performance by switching out halogens
customer_reviews.text: Work well for what they are. If you're expecting stock LED projector performance by simply switching out these for your halogens even in halogen projectors you're going to be disappointed. But that's just the physics of the lens housing. The product itself has no flaws. I recommend retrofitting these in LED projectors or else not wasting your money on these because they can never perform as well as the stock headlights from factory. Tried it against a friend's vehicle and they only look fancy but no gain in terms of length of projection.
customer_reviews.author: Yajas Dwivedi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, poorly assembled.
customer_reviews.text: The quality is great. But, I did have to unscrew the white plastic mounting piece that screws into the light housing for my 2010 silverado. I had to tur it 90 degrees and put the screws back into it. Otherwise it wouldn't have lined up with the mounting holes in the housing. Also, the 2 pin connectors are garbage, after installing, I had a flickering problem. I ended up cutting the connectors off and splicing the wires diresctly to each other because they had poor contact with each other. After that everything is working perfect. I'll update this review after a year or so, or if they go bad before then.
customer_reviews.author: DaveTheMechanic

customer_reviews.title: Brighter than 55W HIDs, white, and flashy, but not a perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought these since they are the same length as halogen H1 bulbs (40mm) and therefore fit in my halogen projector housing. I also tried these:though they ended up being too long and I found that the OPT7 LEDs were brighter. I found that there was also no need to adjust the headlights, as they were neither too far down or too high up despite being adjusted for halogens. Now, my only complaints are that putting the securing bracket back on was a little difficult and required some bending of it and the bulb has a little wiggle room, though not enough to interfere with the performance of the bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I know NOTHING about cars. I can drive one, I can put gas in it and I can change my windshield wipers. That is the extent of my car knowledge. So when I had one headlight out, my fiancee told me to buy these headlights. I thought the price was slightly excessive, I debated just buying whatever. But I am so glad I bought these. They are very clear (on my 10yr old Jeep Liberty with foggy headlight lenses) and I can see for miles and miles and miles...definitely worth the price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Schickedanz

customer_reviews.title: not as bright as HIDs but still very bright
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in August of 2016 (now January 2018) and these headlights have been very good in my 2006 Pilot (projectors). I bought these to replace a set of HIDs that I had before which had a failed ballast. These are not as bright as the HIDs were but are close. I one of the bulbs died today and I am now searching for a replacement. these have lasted through hot summers and cold winters and are used often as I drive at night frequently. Overall this is a good product and I liked the "instant on" of LED, but I like the brightness of HID better.
customer_reviews.author: ybeloc

customer_reviews.title: See like never before!
customer_reviews.text: After a year of having these lights here is my review. Nothing negative can be said about these lights. These lights are amazing!! Originally had Sylvania SilverStar zXe in the truck and they were just lacking some of the field of vision. Decided to go to these LED headlights and boom, presto! With these lights nothing is lacking! In lo-beam mode these lights are fantastic. Perfect angle of light to see the distance down the road as well as the shoulder. When hi-beam is enabled, it's unbelievable how much light is thrown! People always think I have my hi-beams on all the time because they're so bright!! Definitely worth the buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Nice lights, a PITA to install but worth the effort.
customer_reviews.text: I installed these LEDs on a 1997 Lexus SC400. The H7 male plug had a different configuration that what was used on the Lexus in 1997 so I had to modify the female to allow the square male to fit correctly. After some electrical tape and tie wraps to secure the fit against time and vibrations the installation required I cut away a significant amount of the existing silicone boot to accommodate the ventilation needed to keep the ballast running cool. Summer in South Florida will be the test... Great lights, lots of intensity, a PITA to install but I think they're worth the effort
customer_reviews.author: George Papison

customer_reviews.title: No Customer Support; NOT STREET LEGAL
customer_reviews.text: Had a problem getting these to fit, so I 3d-printed an adapter. No problem there. Got everything connected, and now NONE of my DRL work and I have a warning in the dash. High-beams work fine, but with the dash warning. I contacted support but haven't heard back after several days. After a few hours of trying to research this problem, I came across an official note from the company; these lights are not street legal. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: You're the jerk with the blinding lights!
customer_reviews.text: These are stupid bright. I dont recomend them for projector bulbs. Since the lights doesnt cast straight forward, not ideal in projectors. In regular housings though, WOW. I had a 2011 Silverado and I got flashed alllll the time. So prepare yourself for that. Mine lasted about 2 years before I had to buy a new pair and they were 100000 times easier to put in than HID's. I have these in my motorcycle, my 2011 Chevy, a 2013 Ford fusion (with projectors), and only the Ford has issues.
customer_reviews.author: Treycord

customer_reviews.title: 2011 Toyota Camry. Good, but not as bright as HID.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because I wanted a plug and play for girlfriend's car, as she already had projector's but the car came stock with halogen bulbs. These are noticeably brighter than the H11 halogen bulbs. However, as other reviews have noted the beam pattern is distinctly different due to design of the led element. Also, if you're looking for the maximum lighting performance, these are not as bright as a proper set of HID's. For the money and convenience, I would recommend the upgrade from halogen to LED (ONLY IF you had projectors, not reflector housings). Reason being, you wouldn't want to be the person blinding all oncoming traffic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All I expected
customer_reviews.text: I hade them professionally installed in replacement for the low beams. The installation took a little over twenty minutes, no vehicle alterations were required. So far I like them and am considering ordering a set to replace the driver/fog lights. If I do, I will go with the yellow coloration since it seems to cut through rain and fog better than the white. Overall I would say, price, quality, and ease of installation make these light bulbs an excellent replacement for OEM bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Horseman 46

customer_reviews.title: Bright as day, but don’t use without projector headlights.
customer_reviews.text: These headlights are very bright, however the beam is not well dispersed if using non projector style headlights. After about a year of use, one of the little fans started making noise when it got cooler/cold out (40f and below). I recently took them out of my car (2011 Chevy Cruze) due to the beam pattern (was not well dispersed because I used OEM headlights without projector lens). They still worked great two years after install and are significantly brighter than the Sylvania Silverstar bulbs that I have in my car now. The Sylvanias however are halogen and cast a better beam.
customer_reviews.author: The Red Baron

customer_reviews.title: Great light wrong connection
customer_reviews.text: Make no mistake these puppies are really good, so good this is my 2nd set! My issue is that not one of the 2 I bought came with the correct connections. Furthermore the customer service phone number is recorded saying "due to getting to many calls please email us. Which I did and a month later I'm still waiting for a response. These are really really good and it was worth me making the new connections I've included a photo of the H-11 connection from their product (on the bottom) which obviously is too big. The top plug is the true size. Since they don't respond to customer service one has to wonder if they know about this issue.
customer_reviews.author: C PZ 61

customer_reviews.title: Look awesome, but had to custom splice wiring in order to use
customer_reviews.text: Would give these lights 5 stars, but the electrical connections didn’t fit my 2016 Chevy Colorado. That’s the model I chose when buying, and the manufacturer said they would fit. Adapters were included for wiring, but not even the adapters would plug into my existing light wire harness. I ended up having to cut and spliced the wires. Hated that I had to cut my factory light plug off in order to splice. Hopefully these lights will last as long as the truck does. As far as LED quality goes, they’re super bright white! Great quality, and look awesome installed.
customer_reviews.author: ZF

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headlight upgrade for your Dodge truck!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 2013 Dodge RAM 2500 Turbo Diesel and I absolutely love them! Easy to install, includes parity reversal cable, and now my low beams make my high beams look useless! These do not blind people but are brighter and allow you to see the road ahead when you're hauling heavy loads and need to see as far ahead as possible. My advice is just to purchase both low and high beam at the same time, you will not regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: robertparten

customer_reviews.title: Not for me...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 2010 F-150. The bulb would not twist completely to lock into the light housing on my truck. It felt like I was going to break the light housing trying to tighten it into place. The flux beam was garbage with my low beans especially my right side, the light beam looked nothing like the picture in the advertisement. The high beams only worked great on both sides. I contacted customer service and I got some bogus answer about adjusting my headlights aim, suggesting Im some kind of idiot that didnt have his headlights perfectly adjusted to begin with. It ended with them saying to request a refund.
customer_reviews.author: tank

product_meta.title: OPT7 FluxBeam H11 LED Headlight Kit Cool White 6K (H8, H9, H16) w/Clear ARC-LENS Beam Bulbs- 130w 11,000Lm CREE-2 Yr Warranty
feature_bullets: A 360 Approach on Light Output- Flux beam v 2 H11 LED Headlight Bulb doesn’t place it’s focus ONLY on lumens/brightness but on ALL 3 components of light output that determine the quality of light and lifespan LUX- LUMENS- CRI

1 Color available 6000K - Cool White 6K @ 5 500Lms per LED bulb without dark spots! FluxBeam LED v 2 is the only light that uses the all new ARC-LENZ OPT7070 automotive specific LED Chipset and Arc-Beam v 2 technology to ensure an ideal beam pattern

ALL new Roden LED Driver - redesigned inside and out to take advantage of the ARC-LENZ LED Bulb Chipset The deep crafted red aluminium ridges ensure the new LED Driver maintains optimal operating temperatures A reminder than nearly half of LED Headlight failures come from everything but the LED Diode themselves

Plug-N-Play Flux Beam LED headlights are made to replace nearly all stock housing and sockets Before ordering check your vehicle owner's manual to confirm your needed bulb size for your desired application (low beam high beam fog)
Every Other Reason- Does your Conversion Kit use Fortune 500 manufacturing partners? A TRUE 2 Year - paired with 10 years of award-winning service? A 60 Day Money Back ? OPT7 DOES

specifications.Model: OPT7 FluxBeam H11 LED Headlight Kit w/Clear ARC-LENS Beam Bulbs - 60w 7,000Lm 6K Cool White CREE - 2 Yr Warranty
specifications.Item model number: OPT7 FluxBeam H11 LED Headlight Kit 6K
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars4,432 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
